channel.title: Me banned from my own server
channel.description:
My name was Teh Roffles
someone logged in as _Teh Roffles
And i forgot the _ and i banned myself, how do i unban it?
I tried deleteing the acc and makin a new one, but it doesnt work, help me?

item.title: Me banned from my own server
item.dc:creator: @dracar dracar
item.description:
@dracar wrote:

no, in client, there are a few ban listings but they are written into the code, using a command wont add anything to the client file. so its were everyone else has been saying, banneduseres.dat or .txt

Read full topic

someone logged in as _Teh Roffles

And i forgot the _ and i banned myself, how do i unban it?

I tried deleteing the acc and makin a new one, but it doesnt work, help me?[/quote]

why not make another account its your server you can make it admin again

item.source: Me banned from my own server

item.title: Me banned from my own server
item.dc:creator: @sonjichan sonjichan
item.description:
@sonjichan wrote:

Geez I told him that at first, but no it had to be all complicated lmao.

Generally most bans are saved in the data folder, under bannedusers. Search that and remove your name from list.

The client.java does nothing more than tell it where to save the banned users, which is where I told you to remove it in the first place.

Read full topic
item.source: Me banned from my own server

Go to the data folder, open bannedusers.txt

Remove teh roffles

Read full topic

item.title: Me banned from my own server
item.dc:creator: @Teh_Roffles Teh Roffles
item.description:
@Teh_Roffles wrote:

It doesnt have a list it has stuff like this

public int checkbannedusers()
{
try
{
BufferedReader in = new BufferedReader(new FileReader("./data/bannedusers.txt"));
String data = null;
while ((data = in.readLine()) != null)
{
if (playerName.equalsIgnoreCase(data))
{
return 5;
}

Read full topic
